title:
Reduce Computational Complexity for Continuous Wavelet Transform in
  Acoustic Recognition Using Hop Size
abstract:
In recent years, the continuous wavelet transform (CWT) has been employed as
a spectral feature extractor for acoustic recognition tasks in conjunction with
machine learning and deep learning models. However, applying the CWT to each
individual audio sample is computationally intensive. This paper proposes an
approach that applies the CWT to a subset of samples, spaced according to a
specified hop size. Experimental results demonstrate that this method
significantly reduces computational costs while maintaining the robust
performance of the trained models.
